msgSnippet: ... Does it? To me, the second piece of code explicitely communicates that I want to assert the code in the block to throw an exception, whereas the first
messageBody:
> in the 2nd piece of code you need as many lines as in the 1st
> piece, but code 1 communicates much better.

Does it?

To me, the second piece of code explicitely communicates that I want to
assert the code in the block to throw an exception, whereas the first
doesn't. It also seems to much better align with the other Junit assert
idioms.

YMMV, of course.

Regards, Ilja
